description: Triangle of numbers a(n,k) = no of partitions of k such that k=n+n_1+n_2+...+n_t where n_1<=2n and n_{i+1}<=2n_i for all i.
comments: Triangle is read in this order: a(1,1), a(2,2), a(1,2), a(3,3), a(2,3), a(1,3), a(4,4), ...
references: Minc, H.; A problem in partitions: Enumeration of elements of a given degree in the free commutative entropic cyclic groupoid Proc. Edinburgh Math. Soc. (2) 11 1958/1959 223-224.
links: H. Minc, A problem in partitions: Enumeration of elements of a given degree in the free commutative entropic cyclic groupoid, Proc. Edinburgh Math. Soc. (2) 11 1958/1959 223-224.
mathematica: a[n_, n_] = 1; a[n_?Positive, k_?Positive] := a[n, k] = Sum[a[i, k-n], {i, 1, 2*n}]; a[n_, k_] = 0; Table[a[n, k], {k, 1, 12}, {n, k, 1, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Oct 21 2013 *)
crossrefs: Rows give A002572, A002573, A002574, ..., columns approach A002843. Cf. A049286 for another version.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
